software-development.name: Crow Chirp
software-development.descriptionShort: This project is a Twitter Clone. It contains key features such as authentication, creating, liking and retweeting posts, commenting on posts and deleting posts. You can also change your profile picture, search for specific posts or profiles.
descriptionLong: This project is a Twitter Clone. It contains key features such as authentication, creating, liking and retweeting posts, commenting and deleting posts. You can also change your profile picture, search for specific posts or profiles.
The frontend is built using Javascript, CSS (Bootstrap) and HTML. The backend is built using Node.js with Express and Express Handlebars. MongoDB was used for the database.
Crow Chirp thought me a lot about session management, authentication, authorization, database management and much more. It was a great project to work on and I learned a lot from it.

software-development.name: VideoStreamTube
software-development.descriptionShort: Using an API from RapidAPI I was able to create a video streaming website. This website allows you to search for videos and watch them. It also has a dark mode feature.
descriptionLong: Using an API from RapidAPI I was able to create a video streaming website. This website allows you to search for YouTube videos and watch them. It also has a dark mode feature.
This project thought me about React and the uses of dynamic routes. It also thought me about how to use an API with best practices in React.

software-development.name: Github/Gitlab Issue Board
software-development.descriptionShort: This is a simple issue board that allows you to create, edit, delete and view issues. You can move the issue around based on the status of the issue.
descriptionLong: This is a simple issue board that allows you to create, edit, delete and view issues. You can move the issue around based on the status of the issue.
The frontend is built using React and Typescript. The backend is built using FastApi and Python. The database is just a simple json file where the issues are stored.
This project thought me about the essentials of a project. I don't need user authentication, authorization, db ... to have a working issue board (POC). I would want to add those things later.
I also learned how to drag and drop elements with the built in HTML5 drag and drop API and I used the dialog tag in html.

software-development.name: Car Rental
software-development.descriptionShort: This website is a prototype for a non-existant car rental company. It has a 'home', 'customer stories', 'vehicle models', 'about us', 'team', and a 'contact us' page.
descriptionLong: This website is a prototype for a non-existant car rental company. It has a 'home', 'customer stories', 'vehicle models', 'about us', 'team', and 'contact us' page.
This project was made by using React and React Router Dom to redirect users to different pages.

data-science.name: Text Summary App
data-science.descriptionShort: This web application is a basic text summary implementation using transformers and NLP to summarize your text in one sentence. It uses a pre-trained model from HuggingFace.
descriptionLong: This web application is a basic text summary implementation using transformers and NLP to summarize your text in one sentence. It uses a pre-trained model from HuggingFace.
The frontend is built using Javascript, CSS and HTML. The backend is built using RapidAPI.
Even though this text summary app uses a pre-trained model, it thought me a lot about how to use NLP and transformers.

data-science.name: Handwriting Hiragana Quiz
data-science.descriptionShort: This is a simple app that uses a self-made deep learning model to recognize handwritten Hiragana (Japanese characters). The model was trained on a large dataset containing Hiragana characters. The app is built using React on the client and Python with FastApi on the server.
descriptionLong: This web app that uses a self-made deep learning model to recognize handwritten Hiragana (Japanese characters). The model was trained on a large dataset containing Hiragana characters. The app is built using React on the client and Python with FastApi on the server.
This application is a quiz, meaning that the user can choose between different Hiragana characters and write them down. The model will then predict the character and return the result to the user.

This project was inspired by my interest for the Japanese language and the Japanese culture (anime, manga, ...). I wanted to create something that would help me learn the Hiragana characters and I thought that creating a quiz would be a fun way to do it.

data-science.name: Ham or Spam
data-science.descriptionShort: This project uses Machine Learning to predict if an sms message is ham (real) or spam (fake). The model is used inside a web application.
descriptionLong: This project uses Machine Learning to predict if an sms message is ham (real) or spam (fake). The model is using inside a web application.
The model was trained using a Kaggle dataset with over 5000 sms messages. The model was trained using the Logistic Regression algorithm.

The web application is built using HTML, CSS and JS on the client and Python (Flask) on the server. The client can input a message and the server will return the prediction of the model (ham or spam).

data-science.name: Sentiment Prediction
data-science.descriptionShort: The goal of this project is to build a model to classify the sentiment of a tweet (neutral, positive or negative).
descriptionLong: This project is a sentiment classification task. The dataset is from Kaggle. This data contains tweets and their sentiment labels. The sentiment labels are positive, negative, and neutral. The goal of this project is to build a model to classify the sentiment of a tweet.
The model was trained using a Kaggle dataset with over 10.000 facial images.

The web application is built using HTML, CSS and JS on the client and Python (Flask) on the server. The client asks for an image of a persons face with color and the server will return the age prediction of the model.

data-science.name: Stroke Prediction
data-science.descriptionShort: A data science project analyzing and creating a model to predicts chance of having a stroke. The visualisation is done using powerBI.
descriptionLong: A data science project analyzing and creating a model to predicts chance of having a stroke. The visualisation is done using powerBI.

This project uses a dataset from Kaggle to predict whether a person is likely to have a stroke or not. You can view the Power BI file in the visualisation folder to see the visualizations that were created using the raw data.
The model created used the GBM algorithm.

data-science.name: Age Prediction
data-science.descriptionShort: This project uses Deep Learning to predict the age of the picture of a person. The model is used inside a web application.
descriptionLong: This project uses Deep Learning to predict the age of the picture of a person. The model is used inside a web application.
The model was trained using a Kaggle dataset with over 10.000 facial images.

The web application is built using HTML, CSS and JS on the client and Python (Flask) on the server. The client asks for an image of a persons face with color and the server will return the age prediction of the model.
